text:
The Union government will give Rs. 148 crore to the National Legal Services Authority (NLSA) for providing help to those who cannot afford legal services, chairman of the Parliamentary committee on law and justice on Sunday said.

Standing committee of the Department of Personnel, Public Grievances, Law and Justice, headed by its chairman E.M. Sudarshana Natchiappan, visited Nagpur Central Prison on Sunday.

The committee is preparing a report on implementation of legal aid provisions across the prisons in the country.

The panel members met some of the Prison inmates here and sought their feedback on the legal assistance received by them, Dr. Natchiappan said. — PTI
title: Centre to give Rs. 148 crore to NLSA
